title: Genetics Terms Quiz
description: Unravel the vocabulary of genetics, from DNA and heredity to genetic engineering and the building blocks of life.

questions.question: What is 'DNA'?
options: A type of protein in the blood
A chemical found only in plants
Deoxyribonucleic acid, the molecule that carries genetic instructions for life

questions.question: What is a 'gene'?
options: A segment of DNA that contains instructions for making a specific protein

questions.question: What does 'dominant' mean in genetics?
options: A trait caused by the environment
A trait that is expressed when at least one copy of the allele is present
A trait found only in males

questions.question: What is a 'recessive' trait?
options: A trait that is only expressed when two copies of the allele are present
A trait that disappears over time

questions.question: What is 'heredity'?
options: The passing of traits from parents to offspring

questions.question: What does 'genotype' refer to?
options: The physical appearance of an organism
The genetic makeup of an organism

questions.question: What is a 'phenotype'?
options: The DNA sequence of an organism
The reproductive cells of an organism
The observable physical characteristics of an organism

questions.question: What is 'meiosis'?
options: A type of cell division that produces sex cells with half the normal number of chromosomes
Cell division that produces identical cells

questions.question: What is an 'allele'?
options: One of two or more versions of a gene

questions.question: What does 'heterozygous' mean?
options: Having two different alleles for a particular gene
Having two identical alleles for a trait
Having no alleles for a gene

questions.question: What is 'RNA'?
options: Ribonucleic acid, a molecule essential for coding, decoding, and expression of genes

questions.question: What is 'cloning' in genetics?
options: Creating a genetically identical copy of an organism or DNA sequence

questions.question: What is a 'Punnett square' used for?
options: Predicting the probability of offspring inheriting particular traits

questions.question: What does 'CRISPR' refer to in modern genetics?
What is 'epigenetics'?
options: The study of changes in gene expression that do not involve changes to the DNA sequence
